leofunc – a simulation of the suggested functionality¶

leofunc.py

A simulation of leo directives as decorators

usage:

>>> from leofunc import Node, directive
>>> @directive('hello', 'hello-expr')
... def eval_hello(world):
...     def _eval_hello(element):
...         return 'hello %s' % world
...     return _eval_hello
...
>>> n = Node("@hello('leo')")
>>> n
 <Node  [@hello('leo')]>
>>> n.head.type
'hello-expr'
>>> n.head.directive
"hello('leo')"
>>> n.head.code
''
>>> n.head.data
''
>>> n.head.text
"@hello('leo')"
>>> n.head.view
'hello leo'
>>>
class leofunc.Body(node, text)¶

concrete implementation of body element

exception leofunc.DownOutline¶

sends the outline iterator down a level

class leofunc.Element(node, text)¶

superclass of a head or body element in a LeoNode

Parameters:
  • node (Node) – a leo node
  • text (str) – raw text associated with the element
del_view()¶

del default obj view

eval(*args, **kwds)¶

the evaluation dispatcher defaults to self.text

eval_view()¶

eval current obj view

get_namespace(**kwds)¶

retrieves namespace and combines tree.namespace

Note: this creates an independent namespace which dies i.e. it is expressly not an inplace namespace.

get_view()¶

returns default object view

parse()¶

updates attributes from input text

render(name='default', **kwds)¶

render to named view or default

set_view(value)¶

set default object view

type¶

retrieves the type of the directive

view¶

default view of object

views(name)¶

multiple views of object with caching

class leofunc.Head(node, text)¶

concrete implementation of head element

class leofunc.Node(head='', body='', children=[], parent=None, type=None, attributes={}, namespace={}, level='')¶

principle Node class

Parameters:
  • head (str) – a string for the head
  • body (str) – a string for the body
  • children (list) – children nodes
  • parent (Node) – a parent node
  • type (str) – the given node-type
  • attributes (dict) – a dict of attributes
  • namespace (dict) – node-level namespace
  • level (str) – the position of a node in an outline
render(**kwds)¶

renders both head and body

walk(node, o=None)¶

recursive node walker sets parents and levels as a bonus cheers castironpi and gabriel (-:

class leofunc.ReDirector(node)¶

abstract redirection class

class leofunc.To(node)¶

the principal redirection mechanism

>>> node = Node('a','b')
>>> to = To(node)
>>> # sets the node's head to 'hello'
>>> to.head.data('hello')
>>> assert node.head.data == 'hello'
class leofunc.ToBody(node)¶

redirects parameters to body object

class leofunc.ToHead(node)¶

redirects parameters to head object

class leofunc.ToParent(node)¶

redirects the parameters to parent object

class leofunc.Tree¶

placeholder for a more functional tree

exception leofunc.UpOutline¶

sends the outline iterator up a level

leofunc.combine(*namespaces)¶

combines dictionaries last dict is prior.

>>> combine({1:2}, {1:3})
{1: 3}
leofunc.directive(symbol, type='', kind='element')¶

a decorator registerings objects as leo directives

leofunc.eval_cheetah(**kwds)¶

evaluates cheetah templates

leofunc.eval_doc(**kwds)¶

creates and registers an @doc directive

leofunc.eval_graph(name='', **kwds)¶

creates and registers an @graph directive

leofunc.eval_pipe(**kwds)¶

creates and registers an @pipe directive

leofunc.eval_py_expression(**kwds)¶

creates and registers an @py directive

leofunc.eval_py_namespace(**kwds)¶

creates and registers an @imports directive

leofunc.eval_py_suite(**kwds)¶

creates and registers an @pyc directive

leofunc.eval_rss(**kwds)¶

creates and registers an @rss directive

leofunc.eval_shadow(*args, **kwds)¶

placeholder for a more functional shadow directive doesn’t really do anything but register the path in the node’s attributes

leofunc.eval_shell(**kwds)¶

creates and registers an @shell and @sh directives

leofunc.eval_shell_value(**kwds)¶

creates and registers an @sh directives

leofunc.eval_template(**kwds)¶

evaluates string templates

leofunc.eval_xtemplate(engine, **kwds)¶

multi-type template directive

leofunc.outline()¶

creates numbered outlines

originally created by castironpi (aaron brady), tweaked by gabriel genelina

>>> o = outline()
>>> o.next()
'1'
>>> o.throw(DownOutline)
'1.0'
>>> o.next()
'1.1'
leofunc.pipe(arg, funcs)¶

creates a functional pipe operating on arg

>>> pipe(1, [lambda x:x+1, lambda y:y*2]) 
4
leofunc.sort_children(**kwds)¶

sorts children nodes

leofunc.strip_all(text)¶

cleans all whitespace in a string

>>> strip_all(' hello world ')
'helloworld'
leofunc.strip_sides(text)¶

cleans whitespace from both sides of a string

>>> strip_sides(' hello ')
'hello'
